intro: Echinospermum brachycentrum var. brachystylum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echinospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
